result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: WCS non-compliance report dated November 3, 2022. Received and filed.

10:19 AM  Defendant Darren M Blair in court.  Attorney Abigail Broze for Peter M Wolff in court for Darren M Blair.  Prosecuting attorney Chelsea Thompson in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defense has received discovery and is waiting for an offer.
Defense requests further proceedings date.
Court will set for projected plea and sentencing.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 13, 2023 at 09:30 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on January 13, 2023 at 09:30 am.
Warrant signed by Judge Michael Bohren cancelled on 10/10/22
Hearing on October 21, 2022 at 09:30 am.

CONDITIONS MODIFIED 10/10/2022:  Defendant to be released during regular business hours only and is to report directly to Wisconsin Community Services upon release. Defendant to comply with GPS monitoring through Wisconsin Community Services.  Defendant is not to come within 1 mile of Victim A/Victim B listed in the Victim Identification Key, or their residence, employment, school or anywhere they frequent. 

PREVIOUS CONDITIONS:  Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  If DNA sample has not been taken from the defendant, the Court orders sample to be taken;  and it may be expunged under 165.77(4) Wis. Statutes.  Defendant to have no contact with Victim A/Victim B listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.  Defendant is not to use or possess any burlarious tools

1:17 PM Defendant Darren M Blair in court, in custody.  Attorney Brandon Carlson for attorney Peter M Wolff in court for Darren M Blair.  District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Jack Rieder.  Attorney Carlson states the defendant did make an appointment to with WCS but was unable to make it in time before he was arrested.  State requests the signature bond be converted to cash bail.  Response argument by Attorney Carlson to reinstate bail.  Court reinstates bail but will amend the conditions of bond in 22CF1251 that the defendant is to not be released unless during duty hours to have the GPS monitor installed with a one mile exclusion zone of Victim A/Victim B.  All other conditions to remain.
Hearing scheduled for October 21, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Waukesha County Public Safety Assessment Report filed by Wisconsin Community Services.
Signed by Judge Michael O. Bohren on October 6, 2022
Failure to Comply with Wisconsin Community Services

Wisconsin Community Service non-compliance report dated October 3, 2022. Received and filed.

**Reviewed by Judge Bohren on October 4, 2022 - Revoke bail, issue a warrant.**

Case called for bail/bond hearing.
Arguments by the Defense.
Arguments by the State.
For the reasons stated on the record Court converts the cash bond to a signature bond in 22CF1354.
Bail in 22CF1251 to remain as previously set.
Hearing set for 10/21/22 to remain as previously set.
Defendant advises he is a transient but gives his business address for the record.
Defendant does not have a phone but provides his grandmother's phone number.
